options.text: two antennas: one for the transmission, and an other for the reception.
two antennas: one interrogates other aircraft transponders, and an other for the reception.
four antennas: two for the transmission, and two for the reception.
a single antenna for simultaneous transmission and reception.

variant.question: Which on-board sensor would typically be used to augment GNSS positional information as part of an Airborne-Based Augmentation System (ABAS)?

options.text: IRS
ADS-B
EGNOS
TCAS II

variant.question: You are flying in polar region, passing Svalbard, while your GPS becomes unserviceable. Which of the following devices can be used during in the meantime, when your aircraft is equipped with an autonomous integrity monitoring system (AAIM)?

options.text: IRS/INS and barometric altimeter
Directional gyro and magnetic compass
Ground transmitters if signals are received.
VOR and DME

variant.question: A flight is planned to Longyear Airport in Svalbard (78Â°15'N). Due to the high latitude the aircraft GPS will NOT be able to achieve RAIM during the arrival phase, with too few satellites in view. If the aircraft is suitably equipped, which of the following could be used for integrity monitoring? AAIM means Aircraft Autonomous Integrity Monitoring.

options.text: AAIM using the IRS and barometric altimeter.
GBAS using the INS and barometric altimeter.
GBAS using the DME only.
AAIM using the VOR and DME

variant.question: Which of the following is an aircraft-based augmentation system (ABAS)?

options.text: RAIM
GPWS
GBAS
SBAS

variant.question: Which of the following correctly describes the principle of integrity monitoring within Airborne-Based Augmentation Systems (ABAS)? ABAS..

options.text: uses redundant range measurements to support Fault Detection (FD) or Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
requires a Satellite-Based Augmentation System (SBAS) to broadcast differential corrections and integrity messages.
uses ground-based radio navigation aids to support Fault Detection (FD) or Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
requires a Ground-Based Augmentation System (GBAS) to broadcast differential corrections and integrity messages.

variant.question: Which of the following statements is correct with regard to aircraft autonomous integrity monitoring (AAIM)?

options.text: It has the capability to measure within the Aircraft systems the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
It has the capability to measure by the ground stations the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE)
It has the capability to measure within the aircraft systems and by the ground stations, the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
It does not have the capability to measure within the Aircraft systems the Fault Detection (FD) and Fault Detection and Exclusion (FDE).
Integrity of the GNSS navigation signals using only GPS signals or GPS signals augmented with altitude.
Aircraft's position in three dimensions from at least 4 available satellites and one on-board inertial system.
Accuracy of the computed aircraft position based on input from at least one ground-based radio transmitter.
Predicted positions of GNSS satellites to ensure that the required Geometric Dilution Of Precision (GDOP) will be available at all times.
